Rename a Drive file

This is a wrapper for drive_mv() that only renames a file. If you would like to rename AND move the file, see drive_mv().

drive_rename(file = NULL, name = NULL, verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

file

Drive File, something that identifies the file of interest on your Google Drive. This can be name(s)/path(s), marked file id(s), or a dribble.
name

Character. Name you would like the file to have.
verbose

Logical, indicating whether to print informative messages (default TRUE).

Value

An object of class dribble, a tibble with one row per file.

Examples

# NOT RUN {
drive_rename("chickwts.csv", name = "my_chickwts.csv")
# }

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
  • Examples
